required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

id_info.org_study_id: The impact of thread length on

clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of Thread Length on Implant Stability
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Thread Length on Implant Stability

brief_summary.textblock: Some studies show that different types of threads in tapered implants result in differences in primary stability. The aim of this study is to a perform a prospective, controlled, randomized clinical trial comparing primary and secondary stability between long and standard thread implants in the treatment of partial edentulous patients.

detailed_description.textblock: The study sample consists of 23 maxillary partial edentulous patients, where 32 implants were placed, with threads of 0.7 mm or 0.3 mm in the location of premolars and molars. The comparison, in terms of primary stability, is made by measuring the ISQ value (implant stability quotient), in four locations (buccal, palatal, mesial and distal). Statistical analysis was performed using the independent T-Test.

primary_outcome.time_frame: On the 1 day of implants placement
primary_outcome.description: measuring the ISQ value (implant stability quotient)

intervention.description: Implants were placed, with threads of 0.7 mm in the location of premolars and molars.
Implants were placed, with threads of 0.3 mm in the location of premolars and molars.
